cortex.inference.air module¶

Adaptive importance sampling inference.

class cortex.inference.air.AIR(model, name='AIR', pass_gradients=False, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: cortex.inference.irvi.IRVI

Adaptive importance refinement (AIR).

Inference procedure to refine the posterior using adaptive importance sampling (AIS)

init_infer(q)[source]¶
params_infer()[source]¶
step_infer(r, q, y, *params)[source]¶

Step inference function for IRVI.inference scan.

Parameters:
  • r – theano randomstream variable
  • q – T.tensor. Current approximate posterior parameters
  • y – T.tensor. Data sample
  • params – list of shared variables
Returns:

T.tensor. New approximate posterior parameters cost: T.scalar float. Negative lower bound of current parameters
Return type:

q

cortex.inference.irvi module¶

Iterative refinement of the approximate posterior

class cortex.inference.irvi.DeepIRVI(model, name='IRVI', inference_rate=0.1, n_inference_samples=20, n_inference_steps=20, pass_gradients=True, sample_posterior=False, init_inference='recognition_network', **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Deep iterative refinement of the approximate posterior.

Will take a variety of methods as the refinement step (see DeepGDIR and DeepAIR). NOTE: this class will not perform inference by itself, but needs to be instantiated from one of the child classes.

Atrributes:
name (str): Name of inference method. model (Layer) Typically Helmholtz init_inference (str): Inference initialization option. inference_rate (float): Rate of inference steps. n_inference_steps (int): Number of inference steps. n_inference_samples (int): Number of samples to draw from the approximate posterior. pass_gradients (bool): Pass gradients during inference. use_all_samples (bool): Use all the samples rather than just last.
inference(x, y, q0s=None)[source]¶

Perform inference

Parameters:
  • x (T.tensor) – Input data sample for posterior, p(h|x)
  • y (T.tensor) – Output data sample for conditional, p(x|h)
  • q0s (Optional[list]) – Initial posterior parameters.
Returns:

Results from inference. list: constants in learning. theano.OrderedUpdates: updates.
Return type:

OrderedDict

params_infer()[source]¶

Parameters for inference.

step_infer(*params)[source]¶

Step inference for scan.

Parameters:*params – shared parameters.
test(x, y, stride=10, **model_args)[source]¶

Testing function for inference.

Returns a larger summary across different number of inference steps.

Parameters:
  • x (T.tensor) – Input data sample for posterior, p(h|x)
  • y (T.tensor) – Output data sample for conditional, p(x|h)
  • stride (int) – Stride for result summary
  • model_args (dict) – dictionary of arguments for model results.
Returns:

Only first- and last-step results. OrderedDict: tensors for visualization, etc. OrderedDict: complete result summary theano.OrderedUpdates: updates.
Return type:

OrderedDict
unpack_infer(outs)[source]¶

Unpack inference.

Parameters:outs (list) –
class cortex.inference.irvi.IRVI(model, name='IRVI', inference_rate=0.1, n_inference_samples=20, n_inference_steps=20, pass_gradients=True, init_inference='recognition_network', use_all_samples=False, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Iterative refinement of the approximate posterior.

Will take a variety of methods as the refinement step (see GDIR and AIR).

NOTE: this class will not perform inference by itself, but needs to be instantiated from one of the child classes.

Atrributes:
name (str): Name of inference method. model (Layer) Typically Helmholtz init_inference (str): Inference initialization option. inference_rate (float): Rate of inference steps. n_inference_steps (int): Number of inference steps. n_inference_samples (int): Number of samples to draw from the approximate posterior. pass_gradients (bool): Pass gradients during inference. use_all_samples (bool): Use all the samples rather than just last.
inference(x, y, q0=None)[source]¶

Perform inference

Parameters:
  • x (T.tensor) – Input data sample for posterior, p(h|x)
  • y (T.tensor) – Output data sample for conditional, p(x|h)
  • q0 (Optional[T.tensor]) – Initial posterior parameters.
Returns:

Results from inference. list: constants in learning. theano.OrderedUpdates: updates.
Return type:

OrderedDict

Testing function for inference.

Returns a larger summary across different number of inference steps.

  • y (T.tensor) – Output data sample for conditional, p(x|h)
  • stride (int) – Stride for result summary
  • model_args (dict) – dictionary of arguments for model results.
Returns:

Only first- and last-step results. OrderedDict: tensors for visualization, etc. OrderedDict: complete result summary theano.OrderedUpdates: updates.

Module contents¶

Inference methods.

cortex.inference.resolve(model, inference_method=None, deep=False, **inference_args)[source]¶

Resolves the inference method.

Parameters:
  • model (Helmholtz) – helmholtz model that we are doing inference with.
  • inference_method – (str): inference method.
  • deep (bool) – deep or no.
  • **inference_args – extra keyword args for inference.
Returns:

inference method
Return type:

IRVI
